last_episode_to_air.name: Better Than a Halftime Show
last_episode_to_air.overview: Two college football fanatics fell in love and tied the knot, but now their house needs a game-changing reno for their blended family and styles. Jonathan and Drew completely revamp the main living areas, creating a show-stopping dream home.

name: Property Brothers: Forever Home
overview: Drew and Jonathan Scott are on a mission to help couples transform their houses into forever homes where they can put down roots and happily spend their lives. But before that can happen, they need Drew and Jonathan to unlock the full potential of their house and renovate it into the home of their dreams.

episodes.name: Food and Family
episodes.overview: Newlyweds Ora and Diego live with Diego's parents and grandparents in their single level-home in Richmond, VA.  The brothers help them expand that single-level home so they can better enjoy family time before freshening up the house's curb appeal.

episodes.name: Dream Home in the Vegas Suburbs
episodes.overview: When Troy and Susan found out they were having a third child, they bought a new house in the Las Vegas suburbs for them to grow into. While they love their spacious house, the awkward main floor layout prevents them from having the family home they'd dream.

episodes.name: Fostering an Upgrade
episodes.overview: Jonathan and Drew upgrade a super-sized family's home to give them a modern space the next generation can enjoy.

episodes.name: Family Friends
episodes.overview: Drew and Jonathan's long-time family friends Brian and Meghan bought a spacious Las Vegas home over 13 years ago. Brian loves nothing more than seeing his family enjoying down time together but the awkward layout and dated builder-basic spaces are standing in their way of true enjoyment. Drew and Jonathan step up to tackle the kitchen, living and family room to create a home the whole family will love.

episodes.name: Suburban Vegas Upgrade
episodes.overview: Though they fell in love with their suburban Las Vegas home 13 years ago, raising three boys has taken its toll and it's now tired and severely outdated. Jonathan and Drew come up with a plan for their kitchen, living room, dining room, family room and workout room that leaves them with a home that's ready for the next chapter of their busy lives.

episodes.name: Las Vegas Classic
episodes.overview: After living in the Las Vegas suburbs for years, a couple finally settled down in an older home with character closer to the city. While they love the square footage and the classic vibe, the home is in desperate need of an update. Jonathan and Drew Scott are on hand to tackle the kitchen, office, mudroom and master bathroom to help create a perfect home where they can live with their two teenage sons for the long haul.

episodes.name: JD and Annalee
episodes.overview: Drew and Jonathan's brother JD bought a bachelor pad in a historic Las Vegas neighborhood eight years ago. Since then, he's met the love of his life and recently proposed to her. With the wedding just a few months away, JD and his fiancee Annalee want the outdated abode transformed into a dreamy newlywed home. Now it's up to the brothers to take on a full-scale renovation that leaves their sibling and future sister-in-law with the forever home of their dreams.

episodes.name: Big House, Awkward Layout
episodes.overview: As newlyweds, a couple bought a large, six-bedroom house in Las Vegas with the dream of filling it up with a big family. Three children later, the home's awkward main floor layout leaves some rooms underutilized while others are worn out from overuse. Jonathan and Drew tackle the kitchen, living room, dining room and mudroom to give this family a forever home in which every inch works for the chaos of daily life.

episodes.name: Keep the Charm, Not the Layout
episodes.overview: Since buying their Las Vegas house as newlyweds, a couple's charming home is bursting at the seams with the addition of two kids and a mother-in-law. The home's vintage character is part of its charm but the old-school layout simply no longer works. Jonathan and Drew are prepared to leave all the classic charm while completely transforming the kitchen, dining room, mudroom and all-new in-law suite.

episodes.name: Four Generations and Counting
episodes.overview: A couple's two daughters are the fourth generation to live in their home, but the cramped layout isn't functional for their modern family. Jonathan and Drew transform the house while preserving its history to ensure it works for generations to come.

episodes.name: Raise the Kids, Ignore the House
episodes.overview: A couple has put their all into raising their two teen boys, but they have neglected to give their aging house the love it needed. Drew and Jonathan step in and overhaul the tired living room, kitchen and dining room.

episodes.name: House Proud
episodes.overview: A couple is raising their two girls in the same neighborhood where they grew up. However, their house is so worn-out that their kids are embarrassed. Jonathan and Drew update the kitchen, living room, dining area and basement, leaving them with a home in which they can all be proud.

episodes.name: Family Home Refresh
episodes.overview: A couple that bought their home when they were newlyweds are frustrated by the dated kitchen, lack of storage, and closed-off main floor. Jonathan and Drew overhaul the spaces to create a fresh, modern home that will work for years.

episodes.name: Changing It Up for Teenagers
episodes.overview: A single mom's house lacks space for teenage hangouts and family baking sessions. Jonathan and Drew tackle multiple rooms to give the trio a home where all of their family and friends can hang out in comfort and style.

episodes.name: Forever Home Family Tradition
episodes.overview: This young family loves the idea of raising their kids in a forever home, but if they‚Äôre going to stay put they need solutions for their awkward layout. Drew and Jonathan overhaul the spaces to create a home that works for the chaos of family life.

episodes.name: Marrying the Old and the New
episodes.overview: A couple's vintage home has lost some of its charm after nine years of living there with their twin sons. In order to stay, they agree that the house needs a major update, but they can't agree on exactly what needs to change and how. Drew and Jonathan step in to overhaul the entry, living room, dining room and kitchen, leaving the family with a home they can love for years to come.

episodes.name: Starter House to Dream Home
episodes.overview: Over the years, a couple's home has become the family hub for holidays and celebrations, but the closed-off layout cramps their entertaining and everyday style. Drew and Jonathan tackle a major renovation to turn this starter home into their dream space.

episodes.name: Miracle House to Forever Home
episodes.overview: A couple were told they couldn't have children, but after purchasing a small, two-bedroom home, they're now a family of four. Drew and Jonathan totally rethink their now cramped layout so this miracle family can stay in the home they love.

episodes.name: Hammer, Hammer, Pedal, Pedal
episodes.overview: A family's entire life revolves around cycling, but their house is cramped and doesn't support their active lifestyle. Drew and Jonathan take on the challenge of transforming the house into a forever home that works both on and off a bicycle.

episodes.name: Rescued Into a Forever Home
episodes.overview: After having two kids, the major overhaul needed to create a couple's forever home hasn't happened. They call on Drew and Jonathan to make their living room, dining room and kitchen function for their needs before they adopt a second rescue puppy.

episodes.name: Hand-me-down Forever Home
episodes.overview: A couple bought her childhood home and while it's full of memories, the outdated layout and decor don't work for their family. Drew and Jonathan rework the dining room, kitchen and living room, and take on a special project for their twins.

episodes.name: A Forever Home for Two
episodes.overview: A couple looked at over 50 houses before finding "the one", and they want to maximize every square inch to make it their forever home. Drew and Jonathan tackle the entire main floor and deck to give them their dream home, inside and out.

episodes.name: New Family, New Floor Plan
episodes.overview: A couple's home stopped functioning overnight when they adopted his brother's kids after his passing. Drew and Jonathan overhaul the entire main floor and back deck to organize the spaces and make the home work for their newly expanded family.

episodes.name: Everyone's Welcome
episodes.overview: A couple's home used to be the entertainment hub for their friends, but the addition of their daughter makes it feel like a children's play palace. Drew and Jonathan rework the space to create a home that's perfect for entertaining and raising a family.

episodes.name: Come on Over
episodes.overview: A family loves the small-town charm of their home and wouldn‚Äôt dream of leaving their tight-knit community, but the house feels smaller as the kids get older. Jonathan and Drew rework their main floor so they can entertain and watch the kids become teens.

episodes.name: New Lease on Life
episodes.overview: A single mom that beat cancer wants to transform her closed-off, dated home into an open space where she and her family can heal. Drew and Jonathan reconfigure her main floor to allow better flow and design a kitchen that works for her entire family.

episodes.name: Change the House, Not the School
episodes.overview: After welcoming their third child, a couple is struggling with the lack of space in their home. Jonathan and Drew rework the entire house so the family can stay in the home they love and the school district their eldest son needs.

episodes.name: From Chaos to Calm
episodes.overview: A couple bought a new home that was perfect for their growing family but seven years later, the needed updates are still unfinished. They call on Drew and Jonathan to finish what's been started, rework the main floor and restore calm to the house.

episodes.name: Forty-year Home
episodes.overview: A couple realizes their closed-off layout and underutilized space doesn't work for their growing family. They call on Drew and Jonathan to transform the main floor and balance their modern aesthetic with child-friendly function.

episodes.name: Out of the Past and Into the Future
episodes.overview: A couple loves their 1950s home, but its dated layout prevents everyone from gathering in the same place. Drew and Jonathan revamp their floor plan and create a main living room, dining room and kitchen where they can make memories for 20 more years.

episodes.name: A Forever Home for Avery
episodes.overview: A couple's outdated finished and cramped, closed-off layout is no longer functioning for their young growing family. With the help of the couple's spunky 6-year-old daughter, Avery, Drew and Jonathan step in to create a fresh, bright space.

episodes.name: The New Hub of the Neighborhood
episodes.overview: After putting projects on hold to raise their family, a couple needs help tackling half-finished projects. Drew and Jonathan overhaul several rooms to give the family a bright and cozy transformation they can share with friends and neighbors.

episodes.name: A Home Fit for Superheroes
episodes.overview: A comics-loving couple knows their new home needs a super makeover, so they're living in the basement and haven't unpacked or bought furniture. Jonathan and Drew give several spaces a modern-yet-traditional transformation and help furnish the home.

episodes.name: Healthy Ever After
episodes.overview: After neighbors helped them through a recent health scare, a couple wouldn't dream of leaving their home, but they need more storage, flow and functionality. Drew and Jonathan transform the living room, kitchen and give the couple a bright master retreat.

episodes.name: Old Neighborhood, New House
episodes.overview: A couple bought a home in the neighborhood where she grew up and feel it has tons of potential, but they want to overhaul the floor plan. Drew and Jonathan blend their traditional and modern tastes and give them bright and airy room transformations.

episodes.name: Family Heirloom Home
episodes.overview: A couple is thrilled to raise their kids in the home she grew up in, but a house that used to work for three no longer functions for their family of five. Drew and Jonathan rework the spaces to create a fresh, modern home that blends the old with the new.

episodes.name: New Family, New Floor Plan
episodes.overview: A couple's home stopped functioning overnight when they adopted his brother's kids after his passing. Drew and Jonathan overhaul the entire main floor and back deck to organize the spaces.

episodes.name: With Neighbors This Good
episodes.overview: A couple that lived abroad returned home seven years ago to raise their kids in the perfect neighborhood. As the kids get older, the house is becoming more cramped, so Drew and Jonathan transform the entire main floor into a light and functional space.

episodes.name: Move-in Ready
episodes.overview: A couple's dream of being parents came true when they had their girls, but they've delayed moving to their new home because it needs a complete overhaul. Drew and Jonathan rework multiple spaces to create more flow and give the family cozy transformation.

episodes.name: When Tragedy Strikes
episodes.overview: Just as Drew and Jonathan begin renovating a couple's home, a tree falls on the property and demolishes the upper floor. With the timeline extended, the Brothers transform the entire house to give the family a safe and beautiful space.

episodes.name: So Much Love to Give
episodes.overview: A couple jumped at the chance to adopt four children, but now their home isn't functional for a family of six. Drew and Jonathan overhaul the home to provide a solid foundation for the kids' new lives and a home that will grow with them for years to come

episodes.name: Building the Nest
episodes.overview: Busy newlyweds are ready to settle down and start a family in Las Vegas, NV. Their new home has a stunning outdoor space, but the inside is stuck in the past. Drew and Jonathan rework multiple interior rooms to create a stylish and inviting family home.

episodes.name: Home Run Reno
episodes.overview: An athletic family of four love their home, but their sons' indoor play has left their walls full of scuffs and the floors in need of repair. Drew and Jonathan completely overhaul the main level to create a functional house and space to hang out.

episodes.name: Buying Mom and Dad's House
episodes.overview: A couple jumped at the chance to buy her childhood home and although it holds countless memories, they need help putting their own stamp on it. Drew and Jonathan create more flow, update outdated finishes and help the husband plan a surprise for his wife.

episodes.name: Honoring Lola
episodes.overview: A couple moved to Las Vegas with their kids and her mom, but the chance to live together was cut short when her mom passed away. After taking time to heal, they ask Drew and Jonathan to renovate multiple rooms so they can start over in their dream home.

episodes.name: Forever Home for the Holidays
episodes.overview: A boisterous family of six needs to accommodate their son's accessibility needs and have enough space to host their large family holiday parties. Drew and Jonathan take the reins and transform the main living area, giving them the best Christmas yet.

episodes.name: A Fresh Start
episodes.overview: A veteran, cancer survivor and mother of two looking for a fresh start purchased a home with warm, positive energy, but it is far from perfect. Drew and Jonathan help overhaul the space to transform the house into the balanced sanctuary of her dreams.

episodes.name: Teenager in the House
episodes.overview: A couple moved into their Las Vegas home years ago to give their daughter room to grow, but now that she's a teenager, the house doesn't accommodate them anymore. Drew and Jonathan transform their shared spaces to help this family's home grow with them.

episodes.name: Do It for the Kids
episodes.overview: A Las Vegas couple is following their dream of giving foster children the type of safe, loving environment that they had growing up. Drew and Jonathan rework the main floor to give the home a safety update and a warm vibe for future kids in years to come.

episodes.name: A Musical Forever Home
episodes.overview: A musical family moved into their home over ten years ago, but now that their children are all teenagers, they realize their family's needs have changed. Drew and Jonathan step in to give their home a tune up they can sing about for years to come.

episodes.name: Bringing the Dream to Life
episodes.overview: A former Air Force nurse moved her four kids to the suburbs 17 years ago, but with just her youngest living at home, she's ready to make some updates. Drew and Jonathan help bring their dreams to life with a fresh design that the whole family will love.

episodes.name: From the Big Apple to Vegas
episodes.overview: After having a baby, two New Yorkers decided that they wanted a fresh start and more space in a Las Vegas home. Drew and Jonathan transform the main floor to give them their dream bar and kitchen for entertaining and a place for their little girl to play.

episodes.name: A Bit of Vegas Glam
episodes.overview: A Texas couple moved to Las Vegas to be closer to family, but their outdated kitchen and dining room just won't work for their themed dinner parties. Drew and Jonathan step in to turn their house into an entertainer's dream with a dose of Vegas glam.

episodes.name: Reaching New Heights
episodes.overview: Two very tall travel enthusiasts fell in love with a house in the Las Vegas suburbs, and now they need help to make it the right fit. Drew and Jonathan take their forever home to new heights so that this couple can finally live comfortably.

episodes.name: The Future Looks Bright
episodes.overview: A couple loves the vintage character and features of their 1940s Los Angeles home, but its closed-off layout is no longer functional for their growing family. Drew and Jonathan help them make a clean transformation that embraces both the past and present.

episodes.name: Heart of the Family
episodes.overview: Family means everything to this musician, and her Los Angeles home is where they all come together. However, the cramped flow and uneven floors make it tough for her sister to move around, so Drew and Jonathan open things up to create the perfect layout.

episodes.name: Go With the Flow
episodes.overview: A couple has loved living in their LA bungalow for over 20 years, but the tired home needs a facelift to work with their evolving needs. Drew and Jonathan transform the traffic flow of the main floor to give the home a much-needed feng shui refresh.

episodes.name: Room to Move
episodes.overview: After fate brought them together, a couple fell in love with a vintage bungalow in Los Angeles. Now with two kids, the home's choppy layout can't be ignored, so Drew and Jonathan step in to give this family more room to live and grow for years to come.

episodes.name: Beach Dream House
episodes.overview: A family purchased the LA beach house they've been dreaming of, but while the property is full of charm, it needs work to function as a forever home. Jonathan and Drew give it a modern-boho refresh so this family can settle down by the beach for good.

episodes.name: First Home to Forever Home
episodes.overview: A couple searching for their first home in Los Angeles finally found their cozy cottage. While they love their home, it's very dated, so Drew and Jonathan update its awkward layout and '70s mirror walls to create a colorful paradise for them to grow into.

episodes.name: From Starter to Forever
episodes.overview: A couple thought they found a starter house in her old neighborhood, but three years and two kids later, they've decided to stay. Drew and Jonathan tackle the dated kitchen and uneven floors so this family can keep making memories in their forever home.

episodes.name: Classic With a Twist
episodes.overview: Two newlyweds bought their home from her grandparents to keep it in the family. While the home is spacious, the chopped-up layout makes entertaining a challenge. Drew and Jonathan do a complete overhaul to update the home with elegant, colorful touches.

episodes.name: Making It Ours
episodes.overview: A long-distance couple is finally coming together in Los Angeles, but his Spanish-style bungalow needs a major update. Jonathan and Drew help them ditch the bachelor decor and improve the disjointed layout for a cozy, modern home they'll both love.

episodes.name: Build the Love Together
episodes.overview: Two high school sweethearts love their Los Angeles bungalow, but a hidden kitchen and dated finishes means it needs some TLC before they can settle in. Drew and Jonathan combine modern and boho styles for a cozy update to this couple's beloved home.

episodes.name: Building on a Legacy
episodes.overview: A couple's home has been in his family for generations, and though the property is rich with memories, the disjointed space doesn't work for their modern needs. Drew and Jonathan step in to improve the functionality while honoring this house's heritage.

episodes.name: Leveling Up the Renovation
episodes.overview: A couple set down roots in a community they can't imagine leaving, but with the kids growing up, their home has become too cramped and closed off. Drew and Jonathan clear the way with a modern transformation that is more functional for this active family.

episodes.name: Life's Major Milestones
episodes.overview: After 15 years of memories and milestones in their cozy home, this family can't imagine living anywhere else. With only two bedrooms for five people and limited storage, Drew and Jonathan arrive to revamp the space so they can stay in the home they love.

episodes.name: Modern Cowboy Makeover
episodes.overview: A former cowboy and his family love their vintage ranch house, but the awkward layout, dated yellow kitchen and unsafe fireplace need a lot of help. Drew and Jonathan aim to satisfy their conflicting styles with a bright, modern farmhouse transformation.

episodes.name: A Sturdy and Safe Forever Home
episodes.overview: A couple is attached to their charming and one-of-a-kind 1940s home, but they could do without its more mysterious and dysfunctional quirks. Drew and Jonathan step in to make the most of their space and give this family a modern and stress-free sanctuary.

episodes.name: Life's Major Milestones
episodes.overview: After 15 years of memories and milestones in their cozy home, this family can't imagine living anywhere else. With only two bedrooms for five people and limited storage, Drew and Jonathan arrive to revamp the space so they can stay in the home they love.

episodes.name: Perfect Score Reno
episodes.overview: An active family loves having room for sports in their backyard, but the low ceilings and an awkward layout inside keep the home from being perfect. Drew and Jonathan plan a modern renovation to turn this dated property into an ideal home inside and out.

episodes.name: Building on the Memories
episodes.overview: A husband surprised his wife and daughter with a charming 1950s home, but renovation plans were put on hold when he passed away. Drew and Jonathan want to turn this forever home into a dream home so they can build on the all memories they've made there.

episodes.name: Vintage Meets Modern
episodes.overview: A family thinks their 1960s house is a vintage treasure that's full of charm, but its impractical layout and frustrating kitchen are showing their age. Drew and Jonathan blend traditional and modern elements to turn this aging property into a cozy home.

episodes.name: Do a Little Dance
episodes.overview: A family's beloved home has hosted big gatherings for over 20 years, but the choppy layout is no longer functional for four adults living under one roof. Drew and Jonathan aim to create a modern, spacious home to take this family into the next generation.

episodes.name: The Final Move
episodes.overview: Two high school sweethearts have moved 14 times in 15 years, and they're ready to settle into their single-story house with some '70s quirks. Drew and Jonathan update the awkward floor plan and the main bedroom to make their forever home dreams a reality.

episodes.name: Out of the Time Warp
episodes.overview: A family has decades worth of memories in their home, but the 1980s finishes and very uneven floor levels have them desperately ready for a change. Drew and Jonathan transform the kitchen and living spaces to breathe new life into their forever home.

episodes.name: '90s Builder Upgrade
episodes.overview: A couple bought their builder-grade home while expecting their first child, but now that they're a family of four, the uneven floors and cramped deck are an issue. Drew and Jonathan manage conflicting design ideas to give this home a much-needed overhaul.

episodes.name: Keeping It in the Family
episodes.overview: A mother inherited a home that's been in her family for generations, and soon she will be passing it on to her son. Drew and Jonathan balance the family's design styles to rework the layout and crumbling kitchen so this legacy home will be built to last.

episodes.name: Our Best Friends' Reno
episodes.overview: Drew and Jonathan's best friends from college bought a home with ample potential, but the 1970s style desperately needs an update. The brothers swoop in to transform the entire main floor and give their friends a gorgeous space to finally call their own.

episodes.name: Finding a Positive Balance
episodes.overview: A couple has no intention of leaving their beloved home and its beautiful garden, but the house's dated finishes and choppy floor plan are beginning to weigh on them. They call on Drew and Jonathan to create a balanced, calming layout with a better flow.

episodes.name: A Crafty Transformation
episodes.overview: A family loves the good bones of their home, but with a fourth child on the way, their cramped living space is quickly losing functionality. Drew and Jonathan roll up their crafting sleeves to design an organized home with room for the growing family.

episodes.name: Full Circle Reno
episodes.overview: After meeting in his childhood home 20 years ago, these high school sweethearts are now married and moving into that same house; Jonathan and Drew help transform the kitchen and main living areas, breathing new life into this cherished family home.

episodes.name: Big Family Big Reno
episodes.overview: A couple inherits a cherished family home, but it needs a major reno; Jonathan and Drew open up the main living area and refresh the 80s look so they can continue hosting extended family gatherings in style for decades to come.

episodes.name: All Grown Up
episodes.overview: With three kids growing up quickly, a family's needs have evolved and their house is ready for a major change; Jonathan and Drew make the most of a vast main living area with a mature style the entire family will love for decades to come.

episodes.name: Rockin Reno
episodes.overview: After inheriting his grandparent's house, a couple looks to transform it into a home for their two beloved dogs and his vast guitar collection. Jonathan and Drew reimagine the entire space so they can make new memories for the next generation to come.

episodes.name: The Next Multigeneration
episodes.overview: With a new set of twins, a young family is bursting at the seams living in their small condo and decide to move into her childhood home with her mother. Jonathan and Drew transform the main living spaces to make three generations happy for years to come.

episodes.name: Reno Around the Corner
episodes.overview: After landing a historic home in the LA neighborhood of their dreams, a couple discovers their Spanish Revival style is in worse shape than they thought. Luckily Drew lives down the street, so he and Jonathan arrive to put their local expertise to work.

episodes.name: Midwest Charm in Pasadena
episodes.overview: A couple knew they found their forever home when they purchased a historical house that reminded her of the Midwest childhood home she grew up in. Jonathan and Drew reconfigure the layout so the family can enjoy this beloved home for decades to come.

episodes.name: It Takes a Village
episodes.overview: After a husband's unexpected passing, a woman and her two young children are left with a dysfunctional house they had planned on renovating together. Jonathan and Drew step in and transform a cherished home that holds many precious family memories.

episodes.name: Bright Future Ahead
episodes.overview: A couple moved their family to be near an amazing school for their eldest daughter, but they've always struggled with their home's layout.

episodes.name: New Generation New Design
episodes.overview: A couple is overjoyed with the purchase of his grandparents' family home, but the layout is choppy and the design is outdated, so Jonathan and Drew reimagine the main living areas to create a home that is perfect for now and generations to come.

episodes.name: The Right Note
episodes.overview: A musical family has many cherished memories in the LA home they purchased 11 years ago, but the layout is so choppy they don't even invite guests over. Jonathan and Drew open the floor plan to create a beautiful space to entertain for decades to come.

episodes.name: Reno with a View
episodes.overview: A couple knew they had found their forever home with its stunning views and prime location. But the home‚Äôs interior told a different story. Jonathan and Drew overcome the home‚Äôs major structural issues to create a place they can finally settle down in.

episodes.name: Reno Relief
episodes.overview: After 10 long years of trying to renovate their home, a couple is finally ready to bring in reinforcements. Jonathan and Drew completely reimagine the layout of this beloved home, maximizing every square inch to create the perfect indoor/outdoor oasis.

episodes.name: Outdated Overhaul
episodes.overview: A family loves the neighborhood they're in but can no longer suffer through their outdated home. Instead of moving, they're calling on Jonathan and Drew to make sense of their main living spaces with special attention to their son's love of crafting.

episodes.name: Ditching the Dead Zones
episodes.overview: A couple's ranch-style home already holds many precious memories, but its layout, centered around a massive, unused fireplace needs an overhaul. Jonathan and Drew improve the flow of the kitchen and main living areas to create the ultimate forever home.

episodes.name: Farmhouse in the City
episodes.overview: A family found the perfect home to realize their dream of a backyard farm, but with a baby on the way, they can no longer endure the impractical layout. Jonathan and Drew completely reimagine the home's footprint to create the farmhouse of their dreams.

episodes.name: Split Level Conundrum
episodes.overview: A couple loves the spacious split-level home they moved into eight years ago, but it's drab and dated, the opposite of their colorful personalities. Jonathan and Drew customize every square inch of the home, including building a vaulted ceiling.

episodes.name: Life Out West
episodes.overview: After moving to LA, a British family is thrilled with the character of their midcentury house, but the awkward layout prevents them from feeling truly settled. Jonathan and Drew create organized function in the main floor so they can finally feel at home.

episodes.name: When History is a Headache
episodes.overview: A couple with two kids love their historical century home, but it poses plenty of daunting renovation challenges. Jonathan and Drew aim to completely reconfigure the back part of the house, but a health crisis could stop the entire project in its tracks.

episodes.name: Better Than a Halftime Show
episodes.overview: Two college football fanatics fell in love and tied the knot, but now their house needs a game-changing reno for their blended family and styles. Jonathan and Drew completely revamp the main living areas, creating a show-stopping dream home.
